web_entrypoints.name: window.name Usage
web_entrypoints.description: window.name can be used as an entry point for user-controlled data due the fact that it's accessible cross-origin. Useful when combined with a resource specified under web_accessible_resources.

web_entrypoints.name: location.hash Usage
web_entrypoints.description: location.hash can be used as an entry point for user-controlled data. Useful when combined with a resource specified under web_accessible_resources.

web_entrypoints.name: location.href Usage
web_entrypoints.description: location.href can be used as an entry point for user-controlled data. Useful when combined with a resource specified under web_accessible_resources.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.tabs.query Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.tabs.query returns information about a queried tab and can be used as an entry point for user-controlled data.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.tabs.get Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.tabs.get returns information about a given tab and can be used as an entry point for user-controlled data.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.tabs.getCurrent Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.tabs.getCurrent returns information about the current tab and can be used as an entry point for user-controlled data.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.tabs.getSelected Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.tabs.getSelected returns information about the selected tab and can be used as an entry point for user-controlled data.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.tabs.getAllInWindow Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.tabs.getAllInWindow returns information about the tabs in a given window and can be used as an entry point for user-controlled data.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.runtime.onMessage Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.runtime.onMessage is fired when a message is sent from either an extension process (by runtime.sendMessage) or a content script (by tabs.sendMessage).

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.runtime.onConnect Usage
web_entrypoints.description: Fired when a connection is made from either an extension process or a content script (by runtime.connect).

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.runtime.onMessageExternal Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.runtime.onMessageExternal listens for messages sent from other apps/extensions/websites. Website(s) must be specified via the externally_connectable property in the extension manifest.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.runtime.onConnectExternal Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.runtime.onConnectExternal listens for messages sent from other apps/extensions/websites. Website(s) must be specified via the externally_connectable property in the extension manifest.

web_entrypoints.name: window.addEventListener("message") Usage
web_entrypoints.description: window.addEventListener("message") listens for messages sent from postMessage. If the origin of the message is not checked this can lead to security issues. Additionally, the source of the message should be checked to ensure it's the same window that the Content Script is running on.

web_entrypoints.name: .addEventListener() Usage
web_entrypoints.description: .addEventListener() listens for a JavaScript event. In a Content Script, if a JavaScript event is not validated by checking isTrusted it can be spoofed by a malicious web page.

web_entrypoints.name: jQuery .on() Usage
web_entrypoints.description: .on() listens for a JavaScript event. In a Content Script, if a JavaScript event is not validated by checking isTrusted it can be spoofed by a malicious web page.

web_entrypoints.name: jQuery .bind() Usage
web_entrypoints.description: .bind() listens for a JavaScript event. In a Content Script, if a JavaScript event is not validated by checking isTrusted it can be spoofed by a malicious web page.

web_entrypoints.name: jQuery .delegate() Usage
web_entrypoints.description: .delegate() listens for a JavaScript event. In a Content Script, if a JavaScript event is not validated by checking isTrusted it can be spoofed by a malicious web page.

web_entrypoints.name: jQuery .live() Usage
web_entrypoints.description: .live() listens for a JavaScript event. In a Content Script, if a JavaScript event is not validated by checking isTrusted it can be spoofed by a malicious web page.

web_entrypoints.name: jQuery .one() Usage
web_entrypoints.description: .one() listens for a JavaScript event. In a Content Script, if a JavaScript event is not validated by checking isTrusted it can be spoofed by a malicious web page.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.contextMenus.create Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.contextMenus.create creates a new context menu that accepts user-controlled input via metadata about the context menu right click action that occured. Specifically for the callback onclick. The parameters linkUrl, srcUrl, pageUrl, frameUrl, and selectionText.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.contextMenus.update Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.contextMenus.update updates an existing context menu and accepts user-controlled input via metadata about the context menu right click action that occured. Specifically for the callback onclick. The parameters linkUrl, srcUrl, pageUrl, frameUrl, and selectionText.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.contextMenus.onClicked.addListener Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.contextMenus.onClicked.addListener fires when a context menu is clicked on by a user. The parameters linkUrl, srcUrl, pageUrl, frameUrl, and selectionText can contain user-controlled values.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.cookies.get Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.cookies.get retrieves information about browser cookies. The metadata for these cookies can possible be user-controller, mainly the name and value of the Cookie object.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.cookies.getAll Usage
web_entrypoints.description: chrome.cookies.getAll retrieves information about browser cookies. The metadata for these cookies can possible be user-controller, mainly the name and value of the Cookie object.

web_entrypoints.name: chrome.debugger.getTargets Usage
web_entrypoints.description: The TargetInfo object passed to the callback of this function has user-controllable parameters of title, url and faviconUrl.

risky_functions.name: InnerHTML Usage
risky_functions.description: .innerHTML when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

risky_functions.name: OuterHTML Usage
risky_functions.description: .outerHTML when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

risky_functions.name: document.write Usage
risky_functions.description: document.write when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

risky_functions.name: document.writeln Usage
risky_functions.description: document.writeln when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .html()
risky_functions.description: .html() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .before()
risky_functions.description: .before() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .insertBefore()
risky_functions.description: .insertBefore() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .insertAfter()
risky_functions.description: .insertAfter() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .after()
risky_functions.description: .after() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .append()
risky_functions.description: .append() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .prepend()
risky_functions.description: .prepend() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .wrap()
risky_functions.description: .wrap() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .wrapAll()
risky_functions.description: .wrapAll() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .wrapInner()
risky_functions.description: .wrapInner() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .appendTo()
risky_functions.description: .appendTo() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery .prependTo()
risky_functions.description: .prependTo() when combined with user input can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. When the CSP directive 'unsafe-eval' is used unsafely in conjunction with this function, XSS is possible.

risky_functions.name: jQuery attr("href")
risky_functions.description: .attr("href") when combined with user input in a link can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities via javascript: URIs.

risky_functions.name: setAttribute("href") Usage
risky_functions.description: .setAttribute("href") when combined with user input in a link can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities via javascript: URIs.

risky_functions.name: setAttribute("src") Usage
risky_functions.description: .setAttribute("src") when combined with user input and an iframe src can result in Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities via javascript: URIs.

risky_functions.name: chrome.tabs.update Usage
risky_functions.description: When the url property of the updateProperties argument is controlled by an attacker, a javascript: URI can be specified to obtain Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in the context of the origin running in the tab.

risky_functions.name: chrome.tabs.executeScript Usage
risky_functions.description: If user-controlled input is utilized in creating the string passed in the code property of the details parameter, Cross-site Scripting (XSS) can occur.

risky_functions.name: eval() Usage
risky_functions.description: When user-controlled input is mixed unsafely with JavaScript code and passed to eval, Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can occur.

risky_functions.name: jQuery globalEval() Usage
risky_functions.description: When user-controlled input is mixed unsafely with JavaScript code and passed to globalEval, Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can occur.

risky_functions.name: Handlebars SafeString() Usage
risky_functions.description: When user-controlled input is mixed unsafely with HTML markup and passed to SafeString, Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can occur.
